messages.subject: Re: Looking for adoptive (from  China) parents in the Cincinnati area,
messages.msgSnippet: Carol, My mom and dad have adopted twice from China and will be travelling probably in February to China to complete their third adoption. They have 4 bio kids
messages.messageBody:
Carol,
My mom and dad have adopted twice from China and will be travelling
probably in February to China to complete their third adoption. They
have 4 bio kids (I'm number 3, and am 26 years old) and will now have 7
children total. My little sisters are 5 and 5 (they are 5 months apart,
one has been home since 07/05 and the other is awaiting adoption) and
my little brother is 4 (he's 11 months younger than my oldest little
sister and has been home since 12/06). My parents live north of
Cincinnati about 20 miles. They homeschooled my younger bio sis and I
for a while (my last three years of school and my sisters last years as
well). I unschool my 3 children (ages 7, 4, and 4) and my parents are
comtemplating pulling their children from pre-school/ kindergarten to
homeschool, though I'm not sure that she will be taking
an 'unschooling' approach. My mother is, however, very supportive of my
choice to unschool my children, and will stand up for me and my choice
to anyone, including my sister-in-law (a public school teacher who has
actually told me I'm doing an injustice to my children by unschooling
them!).
If you'd like their contact info, please email me off-list. My mom
loves to meet other adoptive families in the area and I'm sure would
love to meet an adoptive/ homeschooling family!
Tiffany
(from south of Dayton)
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Carol Youngs"
<chaz_youngs@...> wrote:
>
> hello, we are Carol and Charlie Youngs and we have 2 daughter adopted
> from China. Heather is 8 and Gabriella is 7.5 years old. any other
> parents in the same situation out there? So far, in the homeschooling
> community, we haven't met any other adoptive parents out there except
> for one (Sri Lanka)...
> thanks in advance,
> Carol
>

messages.subject: Re:Looking for adoptive (from  China) parents in the Cincinnati area,
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Carol, We are adoptive parents but not adopted from China. Our two boys are from Vladivostok Russia, which isn t actually far from the Chinese border. We
messages.messageBody:
Hi Carol,

We are adoptive parents but not adopted from China. Our two boys are from Vladivostok Russia, which isn't actually far from the Chinese border. We adopted them in 2006 and they are now 4 and 5 years old. I homeschool/unschool... sort of eclectic depending on the area. I know that makes no sense, but any how if you want to chat I'm here!

CeAnne
www.koselfamilytree.blogspot.com

"Not flesh of my flesh, nor bone of my bone; but still miraculously my own." Â  For adoption information and updates on our boys visit us at: www.koselfamilytree.com




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Looking for adoptive (from  China) parents in the Cincinnati area,
messages.msgSnippet: hello, we are Carol and Charlie Youngs and we have 2 daughter adopted from China. Heather is 8 and Gabriella is 7.5 years old. any other parents in the same
messages.messageBody:
hello, we are Carol and Charlie Youngs and we have 2 daughter adopted
from China. Heather is 8 and Gabriella is 7.5 years old. any other
parents in the same situation out there? So far, in the homeschooling
community, we haven't met any other adoptive parents out there except
for one (Sri Lanka)...
thanks in advance,
Carol
